creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund; purchase from the collection of Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: woman strutting with coy look on face below cherry tree in full blossom; flanked by a young girl on either side; woman is wearing voluminous, sumptuous kimono with fierce dragon and peonies; girl on PR holds long object wrapped in red; both girls wear huge headpieces
markings: seals LRC: 一陽齋 {Ichiyōsai}, 豐國之印 {Toyokuni no in}
provenance:
Rene Scholten (bought from Sebastian Izzard)
Scholten Japanese Art until 3/1/2013
Willard G. Clark and Elizabeth Clark
signed: LRC: 歌川豊國画 {Utagawa Toyokuni ga}
title: Prostitute with Two Kamuro Under Cherry Blossoms
